0.question: There were 38 people waiting in line. 12 of them were children. 10 more people joined the line. How many people were in line then?

1.question: There were 35 clowns at the circus. 14 clowns did funny tricks. 15 clowns wore polka dot hats. How many clowns did not do funny tricks?

2.question: 96 children are at the park. 11 children are flying kites. 36 children are playing games. How many more children are playing games than flying kites?

3.question: Jack sold 68 hot dogs at the baseball game. He also sold 27 bags of peanuts. He made $42 today. How many more hot dogs did Jack sell than peanuts?

4.question: There are 24 puppies in the pet parade. 13 kittens are wearing ribbons. There are 5 more kittens than puupies. How many kittens are in the parade?
